newsitem.title: ESTONIA: Estonia Savings Bank sees 70 mln kroon yr profit.
newsitem.headline: Estonia Savings Bank sees 70 mln kroon yr profit.

text.p: Estonian Savings Bank, one of the Baltic state's largest banks, said it expected to make a consolidated profit of 70 million kroons in 1996 after earlier predicting a 45 million kroon year profit.
It said in a statement the forecasts for its 1996 earnings included a contribution from its 75-percent owned insurance subsdiary, its leasing arm and its fund management business.
The bank's first-half profit was 22.4 million kroons and it earned 29.2 million kroons in 1995.
The bank recently agreed to merge with eighth largest bank, the Bank of Industry, and bought the state insurance company.
